div1.p: Consular Général De La République De Liberia En Belgique.
Anvers, 8 Janvier 1887
Monsieur l'administrateur Général

J'ai l'honneur de vous accuser la réception des lettres que vous m'avez eu data du 31 Décembre, ainsi que du Decret du ma nomination du Consul Général de Liberia pour l’État Indépendant du Congo, et du 1e Exequatur par lequel sa Majesté la Roi Souverain, m'autorisai à exercer en .

Suivant les ordres du Roi, veuillez trouver ci-inclus la lettre, que j'ai reçue de Son Excellence le Président de la République de Liberia pour remettre a Sa Majesté la Roi Souverain avec prière du la transmettre à sa haute destination.
Veuillez Monsieur D'administrateur Général les assurances de ma considération Ain très distinguée
le Consul Général de Liberia Prés l’État Indépendant du Congo
div1.fw: Monsieur Edmund Van Eetvelde Administrateur Général des Affaires Étrangères de l’État Indépendant du Congo etc etc Bruxelles.

div1.p: To His Majesty Leopold II
Very Dear and Great Friend,

The letter which You did me the kindness to address to me, announcing Your assumption, by authority of the Legislative Chambers of Belgium, of the title of personal Sovereign of the Independent State of the Congo, not only awakened a lively feeling of pleasure, but it announced a step anticipated by the judgment of the entire world, considering the long, ardent and unselfish devotion of Your Majesty to the regeneration of Africa.

In order that I may in some way assist in facilitating the task which Your Majesty has set before You, I shall, as soon as practicable, accredit near Your Majesty's Government of the Free State of the Congo, a representative who shall on all occasions, assure Your Majesty of my deep sympathy and ardent desire for the prosperity of Your Government.
I beg to renew to Your Majesty the assurance of my highest esteem and of the friendship with which I am,

Very dear and great Friend,
Your sincere Friend,
(s) Johnson.

By the President,
E. J. Barclay.
Secretary of State.

Executive Mansion,
Monrovia, Nov. 20, 1886.
General Consulate of the Republic of Liberia In Belgium
Antwerp, January 8th 1887
Mister General Administrator

I have the honor to accuse you with the reception of the letters that you had to me on the date of December 31st, as well as the Decree of my nomination of General Consul of Liberia for the Independent State of the Congo, and of the exequatur by which his Majesty the Sovereign King, authorizes me to exercise in .

Following the orders of the King, please find included the letter, that I received from His Excellency the President of the Republic of Liberia to return to His Majesty the Sovereign King with prayer of transmitting it to its highest destination.
Please Mister General Administrator the assurances of my consideration very distinguished
the General Consul of Liberia Near the Independent State of the Congo
